item.title: Holly add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Close the door. Write with no one looking over your shoulder. Don't try to figure out what other people want to hear from you; figure out what you have to say. It's the one and only thing you have to offer." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Holly add a quote by Natalie Goldberg
item.description: "Nobody cares much whether you write or not. You just have to do it" -- Natalie Goldberg

item.title: Holly add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "Finishing a book is just like you took a child out in the back yard and shot it." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Holly add a quote by Janet Fitch
item.description: "I decided that if I was never going to sell anything as long as I lived, I might as well do what I want to do 'cause then at least I would've done what I wanted to do in life. What's that worth?" -- Janet Fitch

item.title: Holly add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "No, it’s not a very good story - its author was too busy listening to other voices to listen as closely as he should have to the one coming from inside." -- Stephen King

item.title: Holly add a quote by Sidney Sheldon
item.description: "A blank piece of paper is God's way of telling us how hard it is to be God." -- Sidney Sheldon

item.title: Holly add a quote by Elizabeth Drew
item.description: "The test of literature is, I suppose, whether we ourselves live more intensely for the reading of it." -- Elizabeth Drew

item.title: Holly add a quote by Isaac Bashevis Singer
item.description: "The wastepaper basket is the writer’s best friend. " -- Isaac Bashevis Singer

item.title: Holly add a quote by H. G. Wells
item.description: "No passion in the world is equal to the passion to alter someone else's draft." -- H. G. Wells

item.title: Holly add a quote by Steven Wright
item.description: "A metaphor is like a simile." -- Steven Wright

item.title: Holly add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Holly add a quote by Andre Gide
item.description: "It is better to be hated for what you are than to be loved for what you are not." -- Andre Gide

item.title: Holly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Selfishness is not living as one wishes to live, it is asking others to live as one wishes to live." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Holly add a quote by Marvin Simkin
item.description: "Democracy is not freedom. Democracy is two wolves and a lamb voting on what to eat for lunch. Freedom comes from the recognition of certain rights which may not be taken, not even by a 99% vote." -- Marvin Simkin

item.title: Holly add a quote by Erica Jong
item.description: "Everyone has talent. What's rare is the courage to follow it to the dark places where it leads." -- Erica Jong

item.title: Holly add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "A little talent is a good thing to have if you want to be a writer. But the only real requirement is the ability to remember every scar." -- Stephen King

item.title: Holly add a quote by Tupac Shakur
item.description: "You can spend minutes, hours, days, weeks, or even months over-analyzing a situation; trying to put the pieces together, justifying what could've, would've happened... or you can just leave the pieces on the floor and move the fuck on." -- Tupac Shakur

item.title: Holly add a quote by Richard Bach
item.description: "When you have come to the edge of all the light you have And step into the darkness of the unknown Believe that one of the two will happen to you Either you'll find something solid to stand on Or you'll be taught how to fly!" -- Richard Bach

item.title: Holly add a quote by Richard Bach
item.description: "What the caterpillar calls the end of the world, the master calls a butterfly." -- Richard Bach

item.title: Holly add a quote by Richard Bach
item.description: "That’s why love stories don’t have endings! They don’t have endings because love doesn’t end." -- Richard Bach

item.title: Holly add a quote by Richard Bach
item.description: "Character comes from following our highest sense of right, from trusting ideas without being sure they’ll work." -- Richard Bach

item.title: Holly add a quote by Richard Bach
item.description: "If you will practice being fictional for a while, you will understand that fictional characters are sometimes more real than people with bodies and heartbeats." -- Richard Bach

item.title: Holly add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Write your story as it needs to be written. Write it honestly and tell it as best you can. I'm not sure that there are any other rules. Not ones that matter." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Holly add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Holly add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "Write only if you cannot live without writing. Write only what you alone can write." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Holly add a quote by David Hare
item.description: "The act of writing is the act of discovering what you believe." -- David Hare

item.title: Holly add a quote by James Richardson
item.description: "Only half of writing is saying what you mean. The other half is preventing people from reading what they expected you to mean. " -- James Richardson

item.title: Holly add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "How vain it is to sit down to write when you have not stood up to live." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Holly add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Holly add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain
